title: How Many Calories in Semen?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in semen (average ejaculation), including protein, carbs, fat, and other nutrients based on typical composition.
assumptions: Average human male ejaculation (~3-5 ml volume); composition based on standard physiological data, no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by individual health, diet, hydration, and volume; values are approximate. Consult medical sources for precision.

quick_answer.text: One average ejaculation of semen contains about 20 kcal, mainly from sugars and proteins.

label_note: Values approximate Nutrition Facts style; semen is not a typical food but has trace nutrients.

tweaks.label: Higher volume ejaculation (5 ml vs. 3.5 ml)

faqs.q: How many calories are in one ejaculation of semen?
faqs.a: Approximately 20 kcal for an average 3.5 ml volume.

faqs.q: What nutrients are in semen besides calories?
faqs.a: Mainly 2.5 g carbs (including 2 g sugars), 1 g protein, and minimal fat (0.3 g).

faqs.q: Does semen have protein for nutrition?
faqs.a: Yes, about 1 g per ejaculation, but it's not a significant dietary source.

faqs.q: How does diet affect calories in semen?
faqs.a: Higher sugar intake can increase fructose (calories), while dehydration reduces volume and totals.

faqs.q: Is semen high in sodium or cholesterol?
faqs.a: Low: ~50 mg sodium and ~10 mg cholesterol per average ejaculation.
